## Setup Vendors
To enable full Markdown parsing, download the marked.js library:
1. Go to https://github.com/markedjs/marked/releases 2. Download the latest `marked.min.js` UMD build 3. Save it as `lib/marked.min.js` (replacing the placeholder)
Without this step, posts will display as plain text instead of rendered Markdown.
## Adding New Posts
1. **Create the Markdown file**: Add `posts/your-post-slug.md` 2. **Update the manifest**: Add an entry to `posts/index.json`: ```json { "slug": "your-post-slug", "title": "Your Post Title", "date": "2025-08-30", "description": "Brief description for search and RSS" } ``` 3. **Update feeds** (optional): Manually update `feed.xml` and `sitemap.xml` with the new post
## Hosting
This blog works on any static hosting service:
### GitHub Pages 1. Push to a GitHub repository 2. Enable Pages in repository settings 3. Update `feed.xml` and `sitemap.xml` with your GitHub Pages URL
### Netlify 1. Connect your repository to Netlify 2. Deploy settings: Build command (none), Publish directory: `/` 3. Update XML files with your Netlify URL
### Amazon S3 1. Upload all files to an S3 bucket 2. Enable static website hosting 3. Update XML files with your S3 website URL
### Local Development Simply open `index.html` in a browser, or use a local server: ```bash # Python 3 python -m http.server 8000
# Node.js (if you have http-server installed) npx http-server
# PHP php -S localhost:8000 ```
## Customization
### Styling - Edit `styles.css` - uses CSS custom properties for easy theming - Colors automatically adapt to system dark/light mode preference - Responsive design works on mobile and desktop
### Configuration - Update `BLOG_CONFIG` in `main.js` for site title and description - Modify XML files with your actual domain - Customize the site header in `index.html`
### Optional Enhancements - **Tags**: Add `tags` array to post metadata and filter functionality - **Pagination**: Limit posts per page and add navigation - **Code highlighting**: Add Prism.js or highlight.js - **Comments**: Integrate with services like Disqus or utterances - **Analytics**: Add Google Analytics or similar - **Search**: Upgrade to full-text search with lunr.js
## Browser Support
Works in all modern browsers that support: - ES2017+ (async/await) - CSS Custom Properties - History API - Fetch API
For older browsers, consider adding polyfills.
